author: Laiqh A
text:
The Congress is looking to unite secular forces in the next round of elections to Assemblies of four States and the Union Territory of Puducherry.

Speaking at a press conference here on Monday, Leader of the Congress in the Lok Sabha M. Mallikarjun Kharge said that the Bharatiya Janata Party has no base in the four States, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala and Assam, and Puducherry, which are scheduled to go to polls in April and May this year.

The Congress leader, who is also the chairperson of the screening committee for selection of candidates for Tamil Nadu and Kerala and Puducherry, said that the committee is scheduled to meet later this month.

Mr. Kharge also criticised the BJP for destabilising Congress-led State governments.

After bringing down the Congress government in Arunachal Pradesh, the BJP, which does not have the people’s mandate, is now resorting to manipulation of the elected representatives in Uttarakhand, Mr. Kharge alleged. Terming the BJP’s efforts as “murder of democracy”, Mr. Kharge claimed that it was “intoxicated with power”.

The Congress leader said the ruling BJP does not want to have an Opposition party. “It is not possible in India, where the people have faith in the Constitution and secularism,” he said.

Mr. Kharge strongly criticised senior BJP leader M. Venkaiah Naidu’s description of Prime Minister Narendra Modi as “God’s gift for India” and “messiah of the poor”.

West Bengal, TN, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry are scheduled to go

to polls
title: Congress seeks to unite secular forces for next round of Assembly polls
